about.title: About
about.bio: Born and raised in Hawai'i, I moved to Japan to pursue further education and expand my horizons. I came here to grow my portfolio, develop new technical skills, and immerse myself in a different culture and language.
about.whatIDo1: I'm a backend/systems engineer and full-stack developer with a focus on clean, efficient (most of the time), and maintainable code. I specialize in building scalable systems with an emphasis on minimalist design and thoughtful architecture.
about.whatIDo2: Currently, I'm working on several projects including a modern authentication platform, this portfolio site, and confidential client work.
about.whatIDo3: Whether it's backend infrastructure or frontend interfaces, I build complete solutions from the ground up.

checkpoint.title: Checkpoint
checkpoint.short: A modern authentication and identity management system designed to address critical security gaps in existing authentication standards.
checkpoint.description: Checkpoint was built to solve a real problem: many authentication systems in Japan fail to adequately protect user data, exposing private information unnecessarily. My solution provides organizations with a secure, purpose-built platform that properly hashes, encrypts, and stores sensitive client information.
checkpoint.solution: By centralizing authentication through Checkpoint, organizations can focus on their core business while ensuring their users' data remains secure.

boulangerie.title: HAL Boulangerie
boulangerie.short: A sophisticated French bakery website featuring multi-layered parallax scrolling effects, interactive image galleries, and dynamic content sections.
boulangerie.description: This school project showcases advanced frontend techniques through a visually rich bakery website. The hero section implements a four-layer parallax effect where background elements move at different speeds, creating depth and visual interest. The menu section features an interactive product list where hovering over items displays corresponding images in a synchronized gallery, providing an intuitive browsing experience for bakery offerings.
boulangerie.technical: The parallax implementation uses custom JavaScript to calculate scroll position and apply differential transform values to each layer, creating smooth depth perception without performance overhead. The menu interaction system dynamically updates a 10-image gallery grid based on hover events, with images transitioning using blur effects for a polished feel. The site also integrates Google Maps for location display and includes a news section with card-based layouts. Built with jQuery for DOM manipulation, Tailwind CSS for styling, and custom CSS for animations, the project demonstrates comprehensive understanding of modern web development patterns while maintaining my design philosophy of bold colors, generous whitespace, and minimal aesthetics.
boulangerie.disclosure: Materials and images provided by HAL and sourced from the internet. All copyrights belong to their respective owners.

concierge.title: Concierge
concierge.short: An inventory management and device orchestration platform developed for the Hawaii State Department of Education to modernize their mobile device deployment infrastructure.
concierge.description: The legacy toolset was significantly outdated and inefficient. This platform reduced deployment time from weeks or months to just days when provisioning 1,000+ mobile devices.
concierge.confidential: As this project was developed under contract for a government agency, the codebase and infrastructure details remain confidential.

takadanobaba.title: Takadanobaba Fighters
takadanobaba.short: A browser-based game developed as a group project at HAL, designed to showcase the vibrant Takadanobaba neighborhood in Shinjuku.
takadanobaba.description: Built using Pixi.js as its rendering engine, the game runs entirely in browser-based JavaScript. Game assets are dynamically loaded and rendered on an HTML5 canvas through Pixi.js, while the HUD and interactive elements are implemented in HTML and JavaScript.
takadanobaba.timeline: The project was developed in 3 weeks, followed by 2 weeks of refinement and polish.

portfolio.title: Portfolio
portfolio.short: My personal portfolio website, built with Next.js and featuring interactive components powered by GSAP, Three.js, and Framer Motion.
portfolio.description: While I initially postponed creating a portfolio site in favor of other priorities, turning it into a school project proved to be the perfect motivation. The result exceeded my expectations.
portfolio.design: The design takes inspiration from the macOS desktop environment, featuring draggable windows with the signature traffic light buttons, a functional dock, and familiar interface patterns that create an immersive, desktop-like experience.
portfolio.secrets: Several easter eggs are hidden throughout the site. Can you discover them all?

receptionist.title: Receptionist
receptionist.short: An internal platform for managing hardware shipments and device inventory across multiple facilities.
receptionist.description: Receptionist streamlines the entire lifecycle of device management—from initial shipment tracking to device provisioning, user assignments, and decommissioning. Built for organizations that need to maintain visibility and control over distributed hardware assets.
receptionist.features: The platform includes automated email notifications via Resend, API key management for programmatic access, and a comprehensive audit trail for all device movements and status changes.

bob.title: Bob
bob.short: A versatile blob object manager written in Rust that functions as both a standalone client and an authenticated server for managing blob objects.
bob.description: Bob enables efficient creation and management of blob objects from files and folders, with support for both local operations and remote uploads to authenticated servers. The system is built with flexibility in mind, allowing seamless integration with existing workflows.
bob.features: Bob now supports multiple storage backends including local filesystem, AWS S3, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob Storage, and Backblaze B2, providing organizations with the freedom to choose their preferred infrastructure.

jot.title: Jot
jot.short: A minimal, cross-platform notepad application built with Tauri and Rust, inspired by Windows Notepad.
jot.description: Jot strips away unnecessary features to deliver what a text editor should be: fast, lightweight, and distraction-free. Built with Tauri v2 and Rust for native performance, it handles file operations instantly while maintaining an ultra-minimal interface.
jot.philosophy: Sometimes the best tools are the simplest ones. No formatting, no plugins, no bloat—just you and your text.

aer.title: Aer
aer.short: Cross-device, cross-ecosystem P2P file sharing that works like magic—no cables, no cloud, no friction.
aer.description: Aer enables direct peer-to-peer file transfers between any devices on the same local network, regardless of operating system or manufacturer. Built with WebRTC for real-time connectivity and wrapped in a native Tauri application, it provides AirDrop-like functionality for everyone.
aer.technical: The architecture leverages WebRTC data channels for secure, direct device-to-device communication. Discovery happens automatically on the local network, and transfers utilize the fastest available connection path without routing through external servers.

kadai05.title: Tokyo Summer Events 2025
kadai05.short: A multi-page event listing website showcasing Tokyo's summer festivals and cultural events with interactive animations and modern design.
kadai05.description: Built as a school project, this website demonstrates advanced frontend techniques including scroll-triggered animations using Anime.js, dynamic search functionality, and responsive card layouts. The site features a clean, modern aesthetic with carefully crafted interactions and accessibility features.
kadai05.features: The project showcases various animation patterns including scroll-based reveals, ripple effects on hover, and smooth transitions. Built with vanilla JavaScript and Tailwind CSS, it emphasizes performance and user experience without relying on heavy frameworks.
kadai05.award: This project received an award for excellence in design and creativity.
kadai05.disclosure: Materials and images provided by HAL and sourced from the internet. All copyrights belong to their respective owners.

kadai07.title: HAL Kindergarten
kadai07.short: A React-based kindergarten website built with Vite, featuring a clean and friendly interface designed for families.
kadai07.description: Built as a school project, this project demonstrates modern React development practices using Vite as the build tool. The site features a welcoming design with smooth animations and an intuitive layout tailored for parents exploring kindergarten options.
kadai07.disclosure: Materials and images provided by HAL and/or sourced from the internet. All copyrights belong to their respective owners.

cafedeparis.title: Cafe de Paris
cafedeparis.short: An elegant split-screen cafe website showcasing French-inspired cuisine with smooth scroll interactions and an embedded Google Maps location.
cafedeparis.description: Built as a school assignment, this project demonstrates advanced CSS layout techniques using a split-screen design where the left side features a fixed image panel that changes based on scroll position, while the right side contains scrollable content sections. The navigation system uses page indicators that track scroll progress, creating a seamless browsing experience through the menu, about, and contact sections.
cafedeparis.technical: The site implements custom scroll-snap behavior for precise section alignment, dynamic image transitions synchronized with content scrolling, and a fully responsive Google Maps integration for location display. All interactions are built with vanilla JavaScript and CSS, demonstrating fundamental web development skills without relying on external animation libraries. The design emphasizes whitespace and typography to create a refined, upscale aesthetic matching the French cafe theme.
cafedeparis.disclosure: Materials and images provided by HAL and sourced from the internet. All copyrights belong to their respective owners.

journey.title: Journey
journey.short: An immersive travel booking website featuring scroll-based storytelling, animated destination cards, and smooth transitions powered by Anime.js.
journey.description: Journey is a conceptual travel booking platform that transforms browsing destinations into an interactive storytelling experience. As users scroll through the site, they encounter full-screen sections for different Japanese cities, each with its own background image that smoothly transitions into view. A floating card interface dynamically updates its content, price, and styling to match the currently visible destination, creating a cohesive and engaging browsing flow.
journey.technical: The site leverages Anime.js for sophisticated entrance animations and smooth element transitions, creating polished fade-ins and slide effects throughout the interface. Scroll detection logic dynamically determines which section is in view and triggers corresponding updates to the floating card component, including title, location, description, tags, and pricing. The landing page features staggered animation delays that create a sequential reveal effect, while the navigation system includes a dropdown menu with smooth transitions. Background images are implemented with overlay gradients to ensure text readability, and the entire layout is fully responsive using Tailwind CSS utilities. Data is externalized into a separate JavaScript module, demonstrating clean code organization and maintainability practices.
